div.p: DELIBERATE DILIGENT TRY:attempt to SUCCEED in an ACTION.
1. The most general word for physical (and sometimes also mental) effort is perhaps miǎn 勉.
2. Láo 勞 (ant. yì 逸 "failure to put in an effort, relaxed attitude") emphasises the strenuousness and the tiresome nature of effort, and is the most widely used word.
3. Lì 力 emphasises the strength needed to make a effort.
4. Wù 務 emphasises the dutifulness of effort. NB: the meaning "strive to" is separate. See STRIVE FOR.
5. Qín 勤 refers to an honest and strenuous effort.
6. Yòng xīn 用心 focusses on concentration and the consciousness of an effort.
7. The common word jìn 盡 is sometimes used to refer to an all-out effort to do something.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: When Zhong 忠 does not Mean 'Loyalty' Dao. A Journal of Comnparative Philosophy

sense.def: effort used in the performance of work; strategic effort
archaic and poetic, SHI: strenuously; toil strenuously

entry.def: The most general word for physical (and sometimes also mental) effort is perhaps miǎn 勉.

sense.def: with every effort, using all one's strength
make an intense effort; do one's best
make in effort for, work hard towards
strain oneself in VERBING, do one's best to VERB
exert oneself for; do the utmost for

entry.def: Wù 務 emphasises the dutifulness of effort. NB: the meaning "strive to" is separate. See STRIVE FOR.
Láo 勞 (ant. yì 逸 "failure to put in an effort, relaxed attitude") emphasises the strenuousness and the tiresome nature of effort, and is the most widely used word.
Qín 勤 refers to an honest and strenuous effort.

sense.def: laborious effort; putting in hard work
cause to put in strenuous effort

bibl.title: When Zhong 忠 does not Mean 'Loyalty' Dao. A Journal of Comnparative Philosophy

sense.def: dedication; dedicated effort; giving one's best
give one's best; do as well as one can
do one's best for; work wholheartedly for something or someone contextually determinate
give one's best for someone or something
with the utmost effort, German: unter Einsatz des Lebens

entry.def: The common word jìn 盡 is sometimes used to refer to an all-out effort to do something.

sense.def: put in effort for; excert oneself for
do one's best in (agricultural work etc)
cause someone to do all he can> get (someone) to do his very best
cause (oneself) to do one's very best, cause (oneself) to give everything
cause (oneself) to make every effort for N2
exhaust one's energies in an effort towards
make an effort with respect to
make an effort; make every effort
make strained and painful efforts, take upon oneself hardship as a method of self-cultivation
employ strength > use effort to, exert oneself Ving

entry.def: Yòng xīn 用心 focusses on concentration and the consciousness of an effort.

sense.def: be energetic in one's concerns, be intensely concerned about things, show intense concern for things
pay attention and make an effort!
be careful to do; pay special attention to; use one's mind on
make an intellectual effort to V; make the effort to V
do one's best, put in every effort, do what one can

bibl.title: 佛教語大辭典 Bukkyōgo daijiten Encyclopedic Dictionary of Buddhist Terms

sense.def: BUDDH: effort, right effort (one of the Six Perfections of a Bodhisattva; the phon. transcipton is 毗梨耶波羅蜜); skr. vīrya [pāramitā]
BUDDH: put in effort in order to make spiritual progress

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

sense.def: attach strength > put in effort, excert oneself, exhort oneself

form.pron: pí lí yé bō luó luó
bi ril la paal b-raal mbiɡ
bi li jɣɛ pʷɑ lɑ mit

bibl.title: 佛教語大辭典 Bukkyōgo daijiten Encyclopedic Dictionary of Buddhist Terms

sense.def: BUDDH: effort, right effort, pefection of effort (one of the Six Perfections, liùdù 六度; see also jīngjìn 精進); SANSKRIT vīrya-pāramitā
have all my attention focussed on> make every effort on
have all my attention focussed on> make every effort on
make a strenuous effort; struggle along
to put very much effort in one's duties, to work assiduously
devote all one's efforts to V
do one's very best in the cause of duty
with all one's strenght; using all one's effort
